chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Your Response:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

Your Response:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
b_nat: nat
Hb_nat: (2 <= b_nat)%nat
b: Z
Hb: 2 <= b
y: Z
x: Z

Goal:
y < 0 -> 0 < x -> ~ Pell x y

Premises:
Pell = fun x y : Z => x * x - b * x * y + y * y = 1 : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Pell (_ _)%Z_scope
Z.log2_up_unique : forall a b : Z, 0 < b -> 2 ^ Z.pred b < a <= 2 ^ b -> Z.log2_up a = b
Pell_not_diag : forall x : Z, ~ Pell x x
Z.add_carry_bits_aux : forall n : Z, 0 <= n -> forall (a b : Z) (c0 : bool), - 2 ^ n <= a < 2 ^ n -> - 2 ^ n <= b < 2 ^ n -> exists c : Z, a + b + Z.b2z c0 = Z.lxor (Z.lxor a b) c /\ c / 2 = Z.lor (Z.land a b) (Z.land c (Z.lor a b)) /\ Z.testbit c 0 = c0
Z.pow_pos_nonneg : forall a b : Z, 0 < a -> 0 <= b -> 0 < a ^ b
Pell_sym : forall x y : Z, Pell x y < -> Pell y x
Z.log2_up_spec : forall a : Z, 1 < a -> 2 ^ Z.pred (Z.log2_up a) < a <= 2 ^ Z.log2_up a
Z.div_unique : forall a b q r : Z, 0 <= r < b \/ b < r <= 0 -> a = b * q + r -> q = a / b
measure_rect : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> nat) (P : X -> Type), (forall x : X, (forall y : X, (m y < m x)%nat -> P y) -> P x) -> forall x : X, P x
Z.pow_lt_mono_r_iff : forall a b c : Z, 1 < a -> 0 <= c -> b < c < -> a ^ b < a ^ c
QArith_base.Qlt = fun x y : QArith_base.Q => QArith_base.Qnum x * Z.pos (QArith_base.Qden y) < QArith_base.Qnum y * Z.pos (QArith_base.Qden x) : QArith_base.Q -> QArith_base.Q -> Prop Arguments QArith_base.Qlt (_ _)%Q_scope
Z.div_le_lower_bound : forall a b q : Z, 0 < b -> b * q <= a -> q <= a / b
Pell_zero_right : forall x : Z, Pell x 0 < -> x = 1 \/ x = -1
BinIntDef.Z.pow = fun x y : Z => match y with | 0 => 1 | Z.pos p => BinIntDef.Z.pow_pos x p | Z.neg _ => 0 end : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.pow (_ _)%Z_scope
Nat.lt_le_trans : forall n m p : nat, (n < m)%nat -> (m <= p)%nat -> (n < p)%nat
Z.lt_le_trans : forall n m p : Z, n < m -> m <= p -> n < p
Z.le_lt_trans : forall n m p : Z, n <= m -> m < p -> n < p
BinIntDef.Z.add = fun x y : Z => match x with | 0 => y | Z.pos x' => match y with | 0 => x | Z.pos y' => Z.pos (x' + y') | Z.neg y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub x' y' end | Z.neg x' => match y with | 0 => x | Z.pos y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub y' x' | Z.neg y' => Z.neg (x' + y') end end : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.add (_ _)%Z_scope
Z.mul_le_mono_nonneg : forall n m p q : Z, 0 <= n -> n <= m -> 0 <= p -> p <= q -> n * p <= m * q
Z.div_lt_upper_bound : forall a b q : Z, 0 < b -> a < b * q -> a / b < q
Z2Nat.inj_le : forall n m : Z, 0 <= n -> 0 <= m -> n <= m < -> (Z.to_nat n <= Z.to_nat m)%nat
BinIntDef.Z.mul = fun x y : Z => match x with | 0 => 0 | Z.pos x' => match y with | 0 => 0 | Z.pos y' => Z.pos (x' * y') | Z.neg y' => Z.neg (x' * y') end | Z.neg x' => match y with | 0 => 0 | Z.pos y' => Z.neg (x' * y') | Z.neg y' => Z.pos (x' * y') end end : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.mul (_ _)%Z_scope
Pell_zero_left : forall y : Z, Pell 0 y < -> y = 1 \/ y = -1
base_p : forall p : nat, (2 <= p)%nat -> nat -> list nat
Zeq_bool = fun x y : Z => match x ?= y with | Eq => true | _ => false end : Z -> Z -> bool Arguments Zeq_bool (_ _)%Z_scope
mscal_0 : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u x : X), mscal m u 0 x = u
BinIntDef.Z.compare = fun x y : Z => match x with | 0 => match y with | 0 => Eq | Z.pos _ => Lt | Z.neg _ => Gt end | Z.pos x' => match y with | Z.pos y' => (x' ?= y')%positive | _ => Gt end | Z.neg x' => match y with | Z.neg y' => CompOpp (x' ?= y')%positive | _ => Lt end end : Z -> Z -> comparison Arguments BinIntDef.Z.compare (_ _)%Z_scope
Z.le_wd = fun (n n' : Z) (Hn : n = n') (m m' : Z) (Hm : m = m') => (fun lemma : n < Z.succ m <-> n <= m => Morphisms.trans_co_eq_inv_impl_morphism RelationClasses.iff_Transitive (n <= m) (n < Z.succ m) (RelationClasses.symmetry lemma) (n' <= m') (n' <= m') (Morphisms.eq_proper_proxy (n' <= m'))) (Z.lt_succ_r n m) ((fun lemma : n' < Z.succ m' <-> n' <= m' => Morphisms.trans_sym_co_inv_impl_morphism (RelationClasses.Equivalence_PER RelationClasses.iff_equivalence) (n' <= m') (n' < Z.succ m') (RelationClasses.symmetry lemma)) (Z.lt_succ_r n' m') ((fun lemma : n = n' => Morphisms.trans_co_eq_inv_impl_morphism RelationClasses.iff_Transitive (n < Z.succ m...
M22_opp_mult_l : forall (R : Type) (Rzero Rone : R) (Rplus Rmult Rminus : R -> R -> R) (Ropp : R -> R), ring_theory Rzero Rone Rplus Rmult Rminus Ropp eq -> forall x y : M22 R, MU22 Rplus Rmult (MI22 Ropp x) y = MI22 Ropp (MU22 Rplus Rmult x y)
Z.le = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y) <> Gt : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
Z.lt = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y) = Lt : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.lt (_ _)%Z_scope
